qas.question: What illegal trade was the British East India Company involved in?
How many chests of opium did China confiscate in 1839?
The First Opium War led to Britain seizing what island?
When did China outlaw opium trade?

context: From its base in India, the Company had also been engaged in an increasingly profitable <a0_0>opium<a0_0/> export trade to China since the 1730s. This trade, illegal since it was outlawed by the <a3_0>Qing<a3_0/> dynasty in <a4_0>1729<a4_0/>, helped reverse the trade imbalances resulting from the British imports of tea, which saw large outflows of silver from Britain to China. In 1839, the confiscation by the Chinese authorities at Canton of <a1_0>20,000<a1_0/> chests of opium led Britain to attack China in the First Opium War, and resulted in the seizure by Britain of <a2_0>Hong Kong<a2_0/> Island, at that time a minor settlement.
